data.title: Who flew the planes in Dunkirk? And how did they make it look like the actors were flying?
data.meta_description: Answer (1 of 3): It was filmed the good old fashioned way: combining cuts of the real thing, with models, plus other planes made to look like Spitfires. If you look closely at some of the shots, you can tell the “Spitfires” used for the actors’ close-up “hero shots” were actually Yak-52 trainers,...
